repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Fixes: https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/2638

Though still a test is missing.

comment_data.body: `regex.search()` accepts a start position as second argument. That way, we can avoid to slice and copy the source string here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -488,6 +490,13 @@ def parse_dependencies(source_filename):
         cimport_from, cimport_list, extern, include = m.groups()
         if cimport_from:
             cimports.append(cimport_from)
+            m_after_from = dependency_after_from_regex.search(source[m.end():])

comment_data.body: Thanks for the suggestion - didn't know about that. Changed it in a new fixup.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -488,6 +490,13 @@ def parse_dependencies(source_filename):
         cimport_from, cimport_list, extern, include = m.groups()
         if cimport_from:
             cimports.append(cimport_from)
+            m_after_from = dependency_after_from_regex.search(source[m.end():])

commit.message:
Remove unnecessary code

This change was actually unnesarry as with the new regex we iterate
over all possible combinations of package and modules.

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Fix: absolute import handling
